general_advisory: Farmers are advised to take necessary action towards kharif crop cultivation. Farmers should start main field preparation for transplanting of paddy seedlings and vegetable crops and also start planting new fruit crops in orchard by taking the advantage of prevailing rainfall condition. Prevailing weather condition is favorable for sucking insect pest such as mealy bug, aphids, etc. attack in all types of crops so farmers should spray Thiamethoxam 25% WG @ 0.5-0.6g or Imidacloprid 17.8% SL @ 0.5ml or Lambda Cyhalothrin 4.9 % CS per liter of water to control this insects.

advisory: By taking advantage of previous rainfall, farmers should start field preparation for nursery sowing of Paddy.
Before sowing, seed treatment should be done with Carbendazim 50% WP @ 2g/kg of seeds or Trichoderma @ 10 g/kg of seeds.
Farmers those are already done sowing, advised to thin weaker plants in the cotton field at 10-12 days after germination and gap filling.
Keep the field weed free up to 60 days after sowing.

Prevailing weather condition is favorable for sucking insect pest attack in nursery of vegetable crops so its regular monitoring should be advised and after noticing the attack, spraying of Thiamethoxam 25% WG @ 0.5-0.6g or Imidacloprid 17.8% SL @ 0.5ml per liter of water should be advised under clear weather.
Farmers should start raised bed nursery preparation for kharif vegetable crops with proper drainage system to avoid water logging.
Deworming and vaccination of animal against FMD, HS and BQ should be ensured at the beginning of commencement of monsoon.
Soft and tender grass is more palatable to cattle, but magnesium deficiency is seen in dairy cows when eating too much litter, so a variety of grasses should be fed instead of just soft grass.

During rainy season, make provision to ensure proper ventilation by allowing an opening of 1-2 ft at the top of side curtains during the day and the side walls of the empty shed should be completely covered with polythene curtains.
Deworming and vaccination of poultry birds against ranikhet disease must be ensured.
